title: Lockheed Martin ups stake in Terran Orbital, invests $100 million to expand smallsat manufacturing
summary: Lockheed Martin is increasing its stake in small satellite manufacturer Terran Orbital with a $100 million investment.

title: The world’s most powerful rocket finally returns after a 3-year absence
summary: Was the Falcon Heavy a mistake by SpaceX?

title: It’s time to play “find the falling Chinese rocket” once again
summary: We can probably expect reentry into Earth's atmosphere to occur about a week from today.

title: Australia joins ASAT test ban, raising like-minded countries to eight
summary: Australia has pledged not to conduct direct-ascent anti-satellite (ASAT) missile testing, throwing its weight behind the U.S.-driven initiative launched in April to promote the peaceful and safe use of outer space.

title: Perseverance to establish sample cache for later return to Earth
summary: NASA and the European Space Agency have selected a location on Mars to cache samples collected by the Perseverance rover, one step in the overall process of returning those samples to Earth.

title: China tests engines for moon mission rocket
summary: China has conducted a series of successful hot fire tests for engines designed to power a launch vehicle capable of sending astronauts to the moon.

title: SpaceX still an option for future Amazon internet satellite launches, says Senior VP
summary: An Amazon executive says that the company could still call on SpaceX to launch some of its Project Kuiper internet satellites after...

title: Lunar landing restored for Artemis 4 mission
summary: NASA has restored plans to include a lunar landing on its Artemis 4 mission to the moon later this decade, months after saying that the mission would instead be devoted to assembly of the lunar Gateway.

title: China launches Mengtian science module to Tiangong space station
summary: China launched its second space station module of the year aboard a Chang Zheng 5B rocket Monday. The Mengtian module lifted off at 07:37 UTC, and once docked will complete the initial phase of the construction for China’s Tiangong space station.

title: First NorthStar SSA satellites to launch in 2023 by Virgin Orbit
summary: NorthStar Earth and Space, a company planning a constellation of satellites to collect space situational awareness data, will launch its first satellites in mid-2023 with Virgin Orbit.
